reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Strategic Communications Training Program In Dominican Republic and Peru. N/A

description.narrative: Asociación Minga Perú (Minga Perú) drawing on lessons learned from almost twenty years of working with local organizations in the Peruvian Amazon, Minga Perú will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Dominican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Perú will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Perú will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.. Asociación Minga Perú, in Peru drawing on lessons learned from almost twenty years of working with local organizations in the Peruvian Amazon, Minga Perú will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Dominican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Perú will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Perú will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.. Asociación Minga Perú (Minga Perú) is a nongovernmental organization dedicated to improving social and economic conditions in rural communities in Latin America and the Caribbean. Through continued support Minga Perú will develop a new methodology for tra. Asociación Minga Perú will provide training in communications, planning and evaluation for about 63 individuals drawn from current and former IAF grantees in Dominican Republic and Peru and their partner organizations. Participants will receive subgrants to implement their communications strategies and document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. The benefits should flow to between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners.. Asociacion Minga Peru will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Domnican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Peru will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Peru will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.. Drawing on lessons learned from working with local organizations in the Peruvian Amazon, Minga Perú will provide communications training to 60 individuals from current and former IAF grantees in the Dominican Republic and Peru and from the organizations they serve. From that group, Minga Perú will develop a cadre of communications specialists who will go on to use their newly acquired skills to support broader civil society development in their communities and countries. Participants will document lessons and results to share with donors and other interested parties. Benefits from this project should reach between 10,000 and 15,000 individuals connected with the organizations, their communities and their partners. Through this cooperative agreement, Minga Perú will also build bridges to international networks and create a new model for providing technical assistance that may be applied in other countries throughout the region.
